org.vertx.java.core.http

Class HttpServerRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vertx.java.core.http.impl.HttpReadStreamBase
      • org.vertx.java.core.http.HttpServerRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReadStream

    public abstract class HttpServerRequest
extends org.vertx.java.core.http.impl.HttpReadStreamBase
    Represents a server-side HTTP request.

    An instance of this class is created for each request that is handled by the server and is passed to the user via the Handler instance registered with the HttpServer using the method HttpServer.requestHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler).

    Each instance of this class is associated with a corresponding HttpServerResponse instance via the response field.

    It implements ReadStream so it can be used with Pump to pump data with flow control.

    Instances of this class are not thread-safe

    Author:
    Tim Fox

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers()
      A map of all headers in the request, If the request contains multiple headers with the same key, the values will be concatenated together into a single header with the same key value, with each value separated by a comma, as specified here.
      abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params()
      Returns a map of all the parameters in the request

    • Field Detail

      • method

        public final java.lang.String method
        The HTTP method for the request. One of GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, TRACE, CONNECT, OPTIONS or HEAD

      • uri

        public final java.lang.String uri
        The uri of the request. For example http://www.somedomain.com/somepath/somemorepath/somresource.foo?someparam=32&someotherparam=x

      • path

        public final java.lang.String path
        The path part of the uri. For example /somepath/somemorepath/somresource.foo

      • query

        public final java.lang.String query
        The query part of the uri. For example someparam=32&someotherparam=x

      • response

        public final HttpServerResponse response
        The response. Each instance of this class has an HttpServerResponse instance attached to it. This is used to send the response back to the client.

    • Method Detail

      • headers

        public abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers()
        A map of all headers in the request, If the request contains multiple headers with the same key, the values will be concatenated together into a single header with the same key value, with each value separated by a comma, as specified here.

      • params

        public abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params()
        Returns a map of all the parameters in the request
